page.title: 08 EDUCATION....PLAYGROUP
page.content: The young children in our area attend the Village Playgroup, which meets in the Westcott Room ..... a purpose-designed portacabin on the Village Playing Field. For two years a group of mothers fund-raised Â£6,000 and, thanks to the support of our community, the new Playroom was opened in 1983. As a registered charity, the business side of Playgroup is organised by a committee. Fees are 80p. per child per morning. A Supervisor and two Assistants plan and organise the sessions. There is a homely atmosphere where children can play with sand, water, glue and paints etc., dress up and role-play, climb and slide, talk, listen to stories, sing, dance and dramatise. {July 19th.1985 :} Another wet day ! Teddy Bears eat picnics indoors !!!
